doc.name: unicodePlainText

syntax.example: set the unicodePlainText of [chunk of] field to string
get the unicodePlainText of [chunk of] field

doc.summary: Returns the contents of a field chunk as plain text.

examples.example: write the unicodePlainText of field 1 to file myTextFile
put word 1 to 3 of the unicodePlainText of field "lorem" into tFirstThreeWords

history.changed: Now works at field chunk level

description.overview: Use the unicodePlainText property to get the content of a field as plain text with any listStyle properties being converted appropriately into plain-text for the paragraphs the affect.
description.value: The unicodePlainText of a field is a string.
description.comments:
When you get a field's unicodePlainText, the field's text is converted to plain text with any listStyle property being converted appropriately into plain-text.
Any paragraphs with listStyle set are prefixed by an appropriate plain-text form of the bullet or index. The property returns text encoded in UTF-16 in host byte-order.
